contents.text: We promise, it's easy. Just follow these simple steps to administer your CareStart™ COVID-19 Antigen Home Test and see your results quickly. If you want, <video-tag href="https://player.vimeo.com/video/513908490/config" >click here</video-tag>  to watch a short video before you get started.

template_arguments.agreements:
• For in vitro diagnostic use only.
• This product has not been FDA cleared or approved but has been authorized by FDA under an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA).
• This product has been authorized only for the detection of proteins from SARS-CoV-2, not for any other viruses or pathogens.
• The emergency use of this product is only authorized for the duration of the declaration that circumstances exist justifying the authorization of emergency use of in vitro diagnostics for the detection and/or diagnosis of COVID-19 under Section 564(b)(1) of the Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act, 21 U.S.C. § 360bbb-3(b)(1), unless the declaration is terminated, or authorization is revoked sooner.
• Children aged 13 years old and younger should be tested by a parent or legal guardian.
• Wear a safety mask or other face-covering when collecting anterior nares swab specimen from a child or another individual.
• Wash hands thoroughly for at least 20 seconds before and after handling nasal swab samples.
• In order to obtain accurate results, the user must follow the instructions for use.
• Immediately use after opening the test device in the pouch.
• Keep the test device on a flat surface during the testing.
• Keep testing kit and kit components away from children and pets before and after use.
• Excess blood or mucus on the swab specimen may interfere with test performance and may yield a false-positive result. Avoid touching any bleeding areas of the nasal cavity when collecting specimens.
• Inadequate or inappropriate sample collection, storage, and transport can result in incorrect results. If specimen storage is necessary, swabs can be placed into the extraction vial for up to four hours. Specimens should not be stored dry.
• When collecting a nasal swab sample, use only the Nasal Swab provided in the kit.
• Keep foreign substances and household cleaning products away from the test during the testing process. Contact with foreign substances and household cleaning products may result in an incorrect test result.
• Use appropriate precautions in the collection, handling, storage, and disposal of patient samples and used kit contents.
• Handle all specimens as though they contain infectious agents.
• Do not operate your test outside of storage conditions.
• Do not use on anyone under 2 years of age.
• Do not close the App during processing as it may cause an error and you will need a new test kit.
• Do not interpret the test result before 10 minutes or after 15 minutes from when the test was started.
• Do not use on anyone who is prone to nosebleeds or has had facial or head injury/surgery in the last 6 months.
• Do not use if the test device package is damaged.
• Do not touch the tip (specimen collection area) of the swab.
• Do not use the kit contents beyond the expiration date.
• Do not eat, drink, or smoke in the area where the specimens and kit contents are handled.
• Do not interchange kit contents from different lots.
• Do not re-use any contents in the kit as they are single-use only.
• Eye and skin contact with the extraction solution should be avoided.
• Extraction solution should not be ingested.
• The extraction solution in the vial contains potentially harmful chemicals. If the solution contacts the skin or eye, flush with copious amounts of water. If irritation persists, seek medical advice: https://www.poison.org/contact-us or 1-800-222-1222.

contents.text: False negative results may occur in patients who have indicated or whose clinical status or history would indicate they are currently taking high doses of Biotin (> 10 mg per day).

template_arguments.subtitle: Limitations for users taking Biotin (Vitamin B7) supplement:
template_arguments.title: Limitations

contents.text: Wash your hands thoroughly for at least 20 seconds before the test.
Remove your CareStart™ COVID-19 Antigen Home Test components from the box.
Remove the test cassette and place it on a clean, flat surface.
Locate the extraction vial and gently peel off the aluminum foil seal, being sure to keep the vial upright, and place it in the packaging tray.
Important: Do not spill the solution. Eye and skin contact with the solution in the vial should be avoided.
Locate the nasal swab and remove it from the pouch. Be careful not to touch the swab tip.
Gently insert the swab about ¾ of an inch into the LEFT nostril. Then, slowly rotate the swab at least 5 times in a circular path for a total of 15 seconds.
If you have questions, see the CDC Guidelines on Swab Collection
Gently insert the swab about ¾ of an inch into the LEFT nostril. Then, slowly rotate the swab at least 5 times in a circular path for a total of 15 seconds.
If you have questions, see the CDC Guidelines on Swab Collection
Gently insert the swab about ¾ of an inch into the LEFT nostril. Then, slowly rotate the swab at least 5 times in a circular path for a total of 15 seconds.

Gently remove the swab from the LEFT nostril and place directly into the RIGHT nostril, repeating the process of rotating at least 5 times in a circular path for a total of 15 seconds. Remove the swab from the RIGHT nostril.

Gently remove the swab from the LEFT nostril and place directly into the RIGHT nostril, repeating the process of rotating at least 5 times in a circular path for a total of 15 seconds. Remove the swab from the RIGHT nostril.

Gently remove the swab from the LEFT nostril and place directly into the RIGHT nostril, repeating the process of rotating at least 5 times in a circular path for a total of 15 seconds. Remove the swab from the RIGHT nostril.
Place the swab into the extraction vial. Rotate the swab vigorously at least 5 times.

Remove the swab by rotating against the extraction vial while squeezing the sides of the vial to release the liquid from the swab.
Discard the swab into the trash.
Close the vial by pushing the cap firmly onto the vial.
With your finger, mix thoroughly by flicking the bottom of the vial.
Invert the extraction vial and hold the sample vertically above the sample well. Squeeze the vial gently. Allow THREE (3) drops of sample to fall into the sample well.
Important: Click the button below as soon as the sample is added.
When the timer completes, you will need to photograph your test cassette within 5 minutes to interpret the result.
Important: Do not move or lift the test cassette during this time. Do not exit the app during this process.

template_arguments.title: The test is doing its job!

contents.text: Your test is now ready for interpretation. Please place your test cassette on a flat surface and make sure there is good lighting in order to take a photo.
Important: You have {{timer.remaining}} minutes to photograph and authenticate the test cassette prior to result interpretation, otherwise the test will be invalid.

instructions: Position the device within the marked area.
When ready, press the camera button.

template_arguments.description: Is there a PURPLE line next to 'C' on the test?

result.text: Yes, there is a PURPLE line

template_arguments.subtitle: <time-display format="m:ss">{{global.test_timer.remaining}}</time-display> remaining
template_arguments.title: Confirm Result

template_arguments.description: Is there a BLUE line next to 'T' on the test?

result.text: Yes, there is a BLUE line

template_arguments.subtitle: <time-display format="m:ss">{{global.test_timer.remaining}}</time-display> remaining
template_arguments.title: Confirm Result

template_arguments.description: Look very closely at the line next to 'T'. The test line can be very faint.

result.text: Yes, there is a BLUE line

template_arguments.subtitle: <time-display format="m:ss">{{global.test_timer.remaining}}</time-display> remaining
template_arguments.title: Are you sure?

contents.text: Invert the extraction vial and hold the sample vertically above the sample well. Squeeze the vial gently. Allow THREE (3) drops of sample to fall into the sample well.
Important: Click the button below as soon as the sample is added.

cdc_contents: Wear a mask that covers your nose and mouth

contents.text: Your test has been successfully interpreted. Your result is INVALID.

template_arguments.title: Test Result

cdc_contents: Contact your Healthcare Provider to determine the best treatment plan for you

contents.text: Your test has been successfully interpreted. Your result is POSITIVE for COVID-19.

template_arguments.subtitle: Test result Positive
template_arguments.title: Test Result

cdc_contents: Wear a mask that covers your nose and mouth

contents.text: Your test has been successfully interpreted. Your result is NEGATIVE for COVID-19.
Important: If used for serial testing, a second test should be obtained between 24 and 48 hours from now.

template_arguments.subtitle: Test result Negative
template_arguments.title: Test Result

template_arguments.subtitle: Get a new result in 10 minutes or less, or purchase more tests from our online store.
template_arguments.title: Test complete

template_arguments.subtitle: We hope you feel better soon. We’ve emailed you resources to give you peace of mind.
template_arguments.title: Test complete

template_arguments.subtitle: Congratulations on making the world just a little bit healthier, happier, and safer.
template_arguments.title: You’ve done your part!
